source: WHO Global Health Atlas via Johns Hopkins Infectious Disease Dynamics
processing_notes: Source states: '120 cholera cases from January 1 2005 to December 31 2008' - interpreted as sCh cases from WHO Global Health Atlas data maintained by Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health

Source states: 'Eritrea (120 cases; nine deaths) were the two countries with the lowest burdens with two outbreaks reported each during this period' - comprehensive 2000-2023 analysis showing 120 cases and 9 deaths total

column14: Source documents 22 cholera cases in Gash-Barka region among Ethiopian refugees with quarantine measures implemented - specific regional outbreak September 2016

processing_notes: Source states: 'A major cholera epidemic reached the port of Massawa in October 1865
column14: severely affecting the port community with about 300 deaths' - historical outbreak with 100% case fatality due to severe conditions and limited medical intervention
